answers.answer: I have type 2 and have started rowing. I do 30 mins each time and have notice a drop of 50-75pts after exercise. ~180 before exercise and ~125 after. I exercise at night before bed and 3 hours after last meal

All sorts of exercise are beneficial.Weight training builds muscle mass, muscle uses sugar when it is active.Low to moderate intensity aerobic activity will have immediate impact on blood sugar (jogging, swimming, biking etc) and will help reduce it, and the impact can last for 24 hours or more after the exercise.Very intense physical activity may first raise blood sugar, followed by a drop later.if you are on insulin or sulfonurea drugs, you need to monitor your blood sugar before, during and after exercise until you know how you typically respond (then you can still monitor, but maybe less frequently).

Hello im 13 years old and i have type one diabetes and normally if i want to do exercise to help regulate my blood sugar i go jogging or biking but just make sure you dont overdo it because it may result in low blood sugar.

question: Hi I was wondering what type of exercise I can to do to lower my sugars
